p: In addition, CRISPR-based systems have also been highlighted as an alternative to be explored in the search for containment of SARS-CoV-2. Abbot et al. developed a strategy based on CRISPR against SARS-CoV-2 and influenza, denominated PAC-MAN (prophylactic antiviral CRISPR in human cells) [ 153]. Cas13d RNA endonuclease along with guide RNA were used to inhibit and degrade the viral genome and synthesize mRNA in a targeted manner. Promising results were obtained, with degradation of the RNA of the sequences of SARS-CoV-2 and influenza A virus in A549 cells (human lung epithelium).
